data.title: About Culture OC
data.meta_description: On a mission to provide the best possible arts and cultural journalism to Orange County, raise awareness of the area’s cultural richness and diversity, and strengthen the future of our field.
data.text:
OC PRESS CLUB EXCELLENCE IN JOURNALISM AWARDS

​

Best Feature Story

3rd PLACE Anne Marie Panoringan, “Panoringan: Finding New Foods by Living the Buy Nothing Lifestyle”

​

Best Round-Up or Best Of

1st PLACE Richard Chang and Jessica Choi, “A Vibrant Korean Community is Thriving in North O.C.”

​

Best Arts/Culture Story

1st PLACE Paul Hodgins, “Hodgins: O.C. Arts Groups Emerge From Pandemic With New Ideas and Strengthened Resolve”

2nd PLACE Richard Chang and Kim Pham, “‘Yellow Submarine Rising’ Gives Asian American Artists a Platform to Speak and Shine”

​

Best Arts/Culture Review

1st PLACE Timothy Mangan, “London Symphony Orchestra Performs Blockbuster Program at Segerstrom with Mixed Results”

2nd PLACE Paul Hodgins, “A Conductor on the Rise Reveals Her Gifts”

3rd PLACE Timothy Mangan, “Pianists Team for an Evening of Music for Two Pianos at Soka”

HONORABLE MENTION Richard Chang, “Review: OC Museum of Art’s Opening Exhibitions Delight, Confound, Engage”

​

Best Music/Entertainment Story

3rd PLACE Richard Chang, “Danny Elfman Percussion Concerto Makes Its North American Premiere in Orange County”

​

Best Health/Wellness Story

2nd PLACE Anne Marie Panoringan, “Panoringan: Food As Medicine – Cooking With MaxLove Project’s Fierce Foods Academy”

​

Best Religion Story

1st PLACE Hosam Elattar, “OC Muslims Hope For a More ‘Normal’ Ramadan as They Gear Up for the Third Celebration Since COVID”

​

LIBRARY OF CONGRESS

Contributing writers Timothy Mangan and Laura Bleiberg are invited by the Library of Congress to include their stories in its archive for their pieces written for our Decade Ahead series. These stories coincided with the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, giving their insights a unique perspective on issues confronting arts companies in the next decade.

​

​

OC PRESS CLUB EXCELLENCE IN JOURNALISM AWARDS

​

Best Arts/Culture Review

2nd PLACE Paul Hodgins, “‘90s Classic ‘Skylight’ Finds New Relevance at Chance Theater”

​

Best Feature Story

3rd PLACE Laura Bleiberg, “Brea’s Public Art Caretakers”

​

Best Music/Entertainment Review

2nd PLACE Eric Marchese, “Solid Performances and Production Values Elevate Stage Version of ‘Grumpy Old Men: The Musical’”

3rd PLACE Timothy Mangan, “Third Coast Percussion Lays Down a Virtuosic Set at Samueli”

​

​

​

SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA JOURNALISM AWARDS

presented by the Los Angeles Press Club

​

Best Culture News, Online

1st PLACE Richard Chang, “Renaming Historic Sites Continues to Ignite Debate in Orange County”

​

​

​

2019 CALIFORNIA JOURNALISM AWARDS

presented by the California News Publishers Association

​

Best Digital Writing

2nd PLACE Richard Chang, “Renaming Historic Sites Continues to Ignite Debate in Orange County”

​
